Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 06:23PM RockFan wrote: Ladies, first time to post but have been inspired by your stories of encouragement.  Will begin chemo tomorrow (10/31); feeling anxious but hopeful.  Lots to get done this evening.  Like most, feel sick about losing my hair but know it will grow back.  It almost kept me from moving forward.  Keeping a good thought and prayer for all of you.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 05:50PM RockFan wrote: Hi ladies - been a while since I've posted.  Had first treatment 10/31 - mild SEs the first 7 days after - lots of nausea but took all the anti-meds prescribed, and I'm not usually one for meds.  Had bone pain (throbbing) for about 3 days but drank the water.  Very tired - slept more than ever although did manage to work every day, all day.  Have a persistent cough, usually at night.  Developed "thrush" on Day 5 but onc ordered "magic swizzle."  Made an incredible difference and almost feel this week as though I'm back to "normal."  Still have my hair but am waiting...thought I would lose it by Day 12.  Next treatment is 11/21.  Good luck to all!  Keeping you all in thought and prayer.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2008 02:25PM RockFan wrote: Congrats threegirlsmom!  I didn't post alot either but found incredible comfort and support checking the site frequently.  It just reinforces that "you are not alone."  Enjoy the holidays!  I have one more treatment - 01/02/09 and then radiation but herception for an additional nine months, but the hardest part of the journey will be behind me.  Keep the faith.  Best wishes for a healthy and happy 2009!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 05:17PM RockFan wrote: sobx - my rash appeared last Tuesday (four days after treatment).  I'm fair on a good day so I of course scratched until it bled.  It starting to clear up yesterday (Sunday) but there is still evidence of it here and there.   Take care for now -
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2008 03:35PM RockFan wrote: Hi all - I'll add my "Belated Thanksgiving Wishes."  Sorry to hear about your accident, unique, but glad you're all right.  This is eight days from treatment #2 and I'm so miserable.  I told my husband I'm done - but I'm not sure I mean it.  It's been a rough week although I was able to work.  I too developed a strange "rash" which itches like crazy.  Started on thighs, moved to arms and yesterday attacked my hands.  Called the onc office but they said to just mention it when I go next, take Bemadryl and use Gold Bond (it comes in a spray and it did help).  Have no taste buds whatsoever and my sister-in-law was kind enough to postpone Thanksgiving dinner until today to give me a few extra days to feel better.  So nice to have a supportive family and all you wonderful ladies.  Several people have mentioned taking Claritin - just wanted to mention in the interest of cost-savings, the main ingredient in Claritin is called Loratadine.  You can purchase Loratadine on its own - Sam's Club have it.  You can purchase two bottles (150/tablets each) for a total of $11 and some change.  My son has used this for several years at the suggestion of our doctor.   Hope everyone has a great weekend.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2008 12:50PM RockFan wrote: Plakatakr - my treatment is the same as yours - Taxotere/Cytoxan/Herceptin.  A nausea tip - I work in a high school and the school nurse gave me an article re: nausea - it specifically said when chemo patients drank super-shakes containing 32 grams of proten, they had less frequent and less severe nausea than patients who ate normally or added a lower-protein (17 grams) drink to their day's fare.  Protein apparently restores normal slower, steadier stomach muscle contractions.  It said they also required fewer anti-nausea drugs.  Not sure people understand how difficult it is to drink anything some days but promised the nurse I'd share the info with you ladies.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 03:04PM RockFan wrote: Ladies - you are all so inspirational!  Unique - I too get taxotere and cytoxan but haven't noticed any bruising and I usually bruise quite easily.  Started losing my hair yesterday - the day I was dreading.  Knew it was coming but, oh well.  I made it to Day 15 after chemo.  Hope it hangs in there two more days - can't get my wig until Tuesday.  Did manage to take a walk - helps ease the anxiety of it all. Hope you all enjoy the rest of the weekend. RockFan
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2008 12:07PM RockFan wrote: Hi - I'm scheduled for #2 on Friday, 11/21.  Had my head shaved yesterday - emotional but not as traumatic as I anticipated.  Love my wig - or as much as you can love a wig.  Picked up a few cute hats as well.  Hoping to tolerate treatment #2 much like treatment #1.  Keeping all you in thought and prayer.

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2008 09:10AM RockFan wrote: sobx - my rash is fading - I'm not on any antibiotics at the present time and drs office said it wasn't an allergic reaction to the chemo because it didn't appear until four days after - nurse felt it was body fighting an infection of some kind - have since developed neuropathy in my finger tips - have no feeling at all in them.  Kind of strange but doing the best I can. Good luck to all who go this week.  Take care!

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 05:33AM RockFan wrote: I am getting TCH - Taxotere, Cytoxan Herceptin.  I had a port put in at the time of my original surgery even though at the time I wasn't sure how I would proceed.  Now I'm very glad I did.  Took your advice and packed a snack, all the anti-nausea medicines that has been prescribed, book, etc.  Thanks for all the encouragement and support.  So very glad I finally got the courage to register.  God Bless!
